documentation.text:
@notice Allow admin to end sale
 @dev checks the sender is admin and trnasfer the remaining tokens to the admin then selfdestruct

devdoc.author: Selim Sahnoun
devdoc.details: This is an experimental contract, no real estate goods are linked to it

bookOffer(uint256,uint256).details: check that the seller has enough tokens to sell, then push the offer in an array of bookings then emit the corresponding event.

returns._0: boolean indicating the success of the booking.

buyOffer(address,uint256,uint8).details: check there are enough tokens left for sale in the offer, he sends the correct ether value, then run the transfer

params._index: index of the offer in the offerBooking array.
params._numberOfTokens: number of tokens the buyer wants to buy.

returns._0: boolean indicating the success of the transaction.

buyTokens(uint256).details: check the Ether value is equal to price of tokens, there is enough tokens remaining, then run the transfer.

params._numberOfTokens: Number of Tokens the user decided to buy.

endSale().details: checks the sender is admin and trnasfer the remaining tokens to the admin then selfdestruct

devdoc.title: A plateform that handles Real Estate token exchange

bookOffer(uint256,uint256).notice: Allow user to put tokens for sale, it is booked as an offer {amount: number of tokens to sell, price: price per token}.

buyOffer(address,uint256,uint8).notice: Allow user to buy the tokens that are for sale

buyTokens(uint256).notice: Allow user to buy ERC20 tokens.

constructor.notice: assign an admin, connect to the ImmoToken contract and a price for a single token

userdoc.notice: A plateform that handles Real Estate token exchange. You can use this contract for only the most basic simulation
